content: quote: FAIRFIELD, Conn. (AP) -- A busload of activists -- outnumbered 2-to-1 by reporters and photographers -- are paying visits to the homes of American International Group Inc. executives in Connecticut to protest tens of millions in bonuses awarded by the company. About 40 protesters parked at a cul-de-sac Saturday afternoon and walked to the Fairfield home of Douglas Polling. They were met on the curb by two security guards, and one activist read a letter detailing the financial struggles that many Connecticut residents have faced. The group then left the note in Polling's mailbox. Polling already agreed to forfeit his bonus, but the protesters want AIG executives to do more to help working families. AIG has received more than $182 billion in federal aid. -http://biz.yahoo.com/ap/090321/aig_bonuses.html
quote: FAIRFIELD, Conn. (AP) -- A busload of activists -- outnumbered 2-to-1 by reporters and photographers -- are paying visits to the homes of American International Group Inc. executives in Connecticut to protest tens of millions in bonuses awarded by the company. They were met on the curb by two security guards, and one activist read a letter detailing the financial struggles that many Connecticut residents have faced. The group then left the note in Polling's mailbox. Polling already agreed to forfeit his bonus, but the protesters want AIG executives to do more to help working families. AIG has received more than $182 billion in federal aid.

content: quote: Originally posted by OldDoc: What a bunch of BS, the villagers with torches after the monsters now? For whatever my two bits are worth I am going to offer a condolence for your liberalistic attitude. Don't get me wrong, I didn't agree with a lot that Bush did or didn't do, when it was or should have been done. Think back a little Lad, how many times have we been attacked since 9/11? The one positive thing Bush did, was to take means of keeping the country safe from any further attacks. I have made this statement before and will continue to do so. "We haven't seen the last of attacks on the homeland we call America. Not by a long shot have we; and this is what we need to prepare for. Congress is the culprits of the "Bail Out" along with their 'buddies' in the oil cartels. Keep one thing in mind, the President of the united States is no more then a fighrheaed and cannot accmplish anything withou the approval of Congress. Granted some Presidents are capable of thinking outside the box, making sounde dicissions and doing what is good for Americal. while otheres tend to just flow along adn let others doe his bidding, In Name Only"

It seems like these dirty dozen representatives will continue to bust us until we vote them out. Seems kinda easy to me.

content: quote: So you want a society where the working class rise up against the wealthy capitalists to redistribute the wealth. That sounds familiar. Thank you for your response. You not only put words in my mouth to serve a cause I despise but you completely and I suspect deliberately misinterpreted the words I did speak. So why on God's Green Earth would I thank you? Quite simply, I thank you because your misinterpretation of my comments shows what you so-called progressives want. You want me to agree with you--that's not going to happen. Y'see, I know you guys. I've studied what you've done in the last century. There is no way you can walk away from the mountains of innocent bodies your kind created. The Twentieth Century was pretty much a time of misery and war, and it was utopian fools like you that began the bloodbath. Now we're supposed to listen to you again. We're expected to forget the rotting heap of human corpses you left behind the first time. Guess again, you miserable piece of crap!!! If you want to burden yourself with the responsibility for the most murderous regimes the world has ever seen simply because you disagree with the limited ideology of our Founders then that, buddy, is on you. Do not even attempt to slime me with that crap. You wouldn't know a real communist until after he blew your useful idiot head away...

content: OK, I will accept the fact that I misunderstood you. You went to war for our country while I stood ready to be called during the Cold War. I salute you for that. I do not want business executives executed--far better to just simply fire them without "golden parachutes". I do buy into the idea of executing or at least prosecuting corrupt politicians, and I really want to see the ones who made this current nightmare pay. Yes, I can be pretty bloody-minded, but like you I will not act illegally on my own....

Well, I'll be horns waggled, I haven't seen such a pi*******contest in a long time. Reminds me of a group of kids on the playground in knee deep snow, trying to see who could pee the furthest into the wind, at that. How about if we drop back to the ten and regroup................now, how about IF; I think we all agree there is no one in this world of ours deserving of the exorbitant amount of money they call pay checks and bonuses, as these ****** bags in the auto industry and financial conglomerates demand, receive, and expect to receive for ........ever?...... Personally I have the same thoughts towards the professional athletes with the MFL and MLB In any case what might need to be accomplished to bring these fat cats to their knees, would be to create "mass exodus days", where no one purchases what ever products we are boycotting. Say, for example the population must come to an agreement in order to make it happen correctly, by avoiding certain products for a month of maybe even longer. Let's take the auto industry for example. A group decision is made to General Motors products for three months. Across the nation, what's happening? No one is buying and GM products, and for five or six months, this would be or almost be out on the streets. If the citizens as a whole can come together to give a business the cold shoulder effect I most sincerely suggest we will succeed with "coercing" with them to see things as we feel should be. That being no one receives more then 20 percent then the lowest man in the factory makes sweeping up the slag's. That bonuses are a thing of the past. Ether that or they will go out of business for lack of exchanging their product for cast to the masses. WE hear a lot of don't buy gas on Sundays. You know this is the best means we could control the sale of everything in this world. If the world took the stance that no one would buy a Chevy S-10 for example for a year. Do you realize what that would do to the markets? It would cause crippling effects that would be darn near permanent. How about an entire line of general motors products?......Ringo

content: quote: FAIRFIELD, Conn. (AP) -- A busload of activists -- outnumbered 2-to-1 by reporters and photographers -- are paying visits to the homes of American International Group Inc. executives in Connecticut to protest tens of millions in bonuses awarded by the company. About 40 protesters parked at a cul-de-sac Saturday afternoon and walked to the Fairfield home of Douglas Polling. They were met on the curb by two security guards, and one activist read a letter detailing the financial struggles that many Connecticut residents have faced. The group then left the note in Polling's mailbox. Polling already agreed to forfeit his bonus, but the protesters want AIG executives to do more to help working families. AIG has received more than $182 billion in federal aid. -http://biz.yahoo.com/ap/090321/aig_bonuses.html
quote: FAIRFIELD, Conn. (AP) -- A busload of activists -- outnumbered 2-to-1 by reporters and photographers -- are paying visits to the homes of American International Group Inc. executives in Connecticut to protest tens of millions in bonuses awarded by the company. They were met on the curb by two security guards, and one activist read a letter detailing the financial struggles that many Connecticut residents have faced. The group then left the note in Polling's mailbox. Polling already agreed to forfeit his bonus, but the protesters want AIG executives to do more to help working families. AIG has received more than $182 billion in federal aid.

content: quote: Originally posted by OldDoc: What a bunch of BS, the villagers with torches after the monsters now? For whatever my two bits are worth I am going to offer a condolence for your liberalistic attitude. Don't get me wrong, I didn't agree with a lot that Bush did or didn't do, when it was or should have been done. Think back a little Lad, how many times have we been attacked since 9/11? The one positive thing Bush did, was to take means of keeping the country safe from any further attacks. I have made this statement before and will continue to do so. "We haven't seen the last of attacks on the homeland we call America. Not by a long shot have we; and this is what we need to prepare for. Congress is the culprits of the "Bail Out" along with their 'buddies' in the oil cartels. Keep one thing in mind, the President of the united States is no more then a fighrheaed and cannot accmplish anything withou the approval of Congress. Granted some Presidents are capable of thinking outside the box, making sounde dicissions and doing what is good for Americal. while otheres tend to just flow along adn let others doe his bidding, In Name Only"

It seems like these dirty dozen representatives will continue to bust us until we vote them out. Seems kinda easy to me.

content: quote: So you want a society where the working class rise up against the wealthy capitalists to redistribute the wealth. That sounds familiar. Thank you for your response. You not only put words in my mouth to serve a cause I despise but you completely and I suspect deliberately misinterpreted the words I did speak. So why on God's Green Earth would I thank you? Quite simply, I thank you because your misinterpretation of my comments shows what you so-called progressives want. You want me to agree with you--that's not going to happen. Y'see, I know you guys. I've studied what you've done in the last century. There is no way you can walk away from the mountains of innocent bodies your kind created. The Twentieth Century was pretty much a time of misery and war, and it was utopian fools like you that began the bloodbath. Now we're supposed to listen to you again. We're expected to forget the rotting heap of human corpses you left behind the first time. Guess again, you miserable piece of crap!!! If you want to burden yourself with the responsibility for the most murderous regimes the world has ever seen simply because you disagree with the limited ideology of our Founders then that, buddy, is on you. Do not even attempt to slime me with that crap. You wouldn't know a real communist until after he blew your useful idiot head away...

If you want to burden yourself with the responsibility for the most murderous regimes the world has ever seen simply because you disagree with the limited ideology of our Founders then that, buddy, is on you. Do not even attempt to slime me with that crap. You wouldn't know a real communist until after he blew your useful idiot head away... If you despise it, why advocate stringing up executives. What did the founders think about summary executions? That idea doesn't go along with the 5th, 6th, or 8th Amendment. I am far from liberal, progressive, or any other label you can come up with. I have spent the last 14 years serving this country and everything it stands for, including going to war for it. What have you done?
quote: Originally posted by ipw533: quote: So you want a society where the working class rise up against the wealthy capitalists to redistribute the wealth. That sounds familiar. Thank you for your response. You not only put words in my mouth to serve a cause I despise but you completely and I suspect deliberately misinterpreted the words I did speak. So why on God's Green Earth would I thank you? Quite simply, I thank you because your misinterpretation of my comments shows what you so-called progressives want. You want me to agree with you--that's not going to happen. Y'see, I know you guys. I've studied what you've done in the last century. There is no way you can walk away from the mountains of innocent bodies your kind created. The Twentieth Century was pretty much a time of misery and war, and it was utopian fools like you that began the bloodbath. Now we're supposed to listen to you again. We're expected to forget the rotting heap of human corpses you left behind the first time. Guess again, you miserable piece of crap!!! If you want to burden yourself with the responsibility for the most murderous regimes the world has ever seen simply because you disagree with the limited ideology of our Founders then that, buddy, is on you. Do not even attempt to slime me with that crap. You wouldn't know a real communist until after he blew your useful idiot head away...
reply: If you despise it, why advocate stringing up executives. What did the founders think about summary executions? That idea doesn't go along with the 5th, 6th, or 8th Amendment. I am far from liberal, progressive, or any other label you can come up with. I have spent the last 14 years serving this country and everything it stands for, including going to war for it. What have you done?
title: Main Street is waking up.  Finally.

content: OK, I will accept the fact that I misunderstood you. You went to war for our country while I stood ready to be called during the Cold War. I salute you for that. I do not want business executives executed--far better to just simply fire them without "golden parachutes". I do buy into the idea of executing or at least prosecuting corrupt politicians, and I really want to see the ones who made this current nightmare pay. Yes, I can be pretty bloody-minded, but like you I will not act illegally on my own....
reply: OK, I will accept the fact that I misunderstood you. You went to war for our country while I stood ready to be called during the Cold War. I salute you for that. content: Your both wrong, mobs should go after politicians, democrat and republicans, as well as corporate fat cats. quote: Originally posted by bounceandburst: quote: Originally posted by Irwin_R_Schyster: No, the outrage is not directed at the real culprits: George W Bush/Dick Cheney.....There should be MOBS harrassing them everywhere they go... You're correct that the outrage is not directed at the real culprits.....it should be directed at Geithner, Sen. Dodd, etal., the authors of the AIG bailout and "Porkulous" bill.
quote: Originally posted by bounceandburst: quote: Originally posted by Irwin_R_Schyster: No, the outrage is not directed at the real culprits: George W Bush/Dick Cheney.....There should be MOBS harrassing them everywhere they go... title: Main Street is waking up.  Finally.

content: quote: Originally posted by fishnfanatic: Your both wrong, mobs should go after politicians, democrat and republicans, as well as corporate fat cats. quote: Originally posted by bounceandburst: quote: Originally posted by Irwin_R_Schyster: No, the outrage is not directed at the real culprits: George W Bush/Dick Cheney.....There should be MOBS harrassing them everywhere they go... You're correct that the outrage is not directed at the real culprits.....it should be directed at Geithner, Sen. Dodd, etal., the authors of the AIG bailout and "Porkulous" bill. Well, I'll be horns waggled, I haven't seen such a pi*******contest in a long time. Reminds me of a group of kids on the playground in knee deep snow, trying to see who could pee the furthest into the wind, at that. How about if we drop back to the ten and regroup................now, how about IF; I think we all agree there is no one in this world of ours deserving of the exorbitant amount of money they call pay checks and bonuses, as these ****** bags in the auto industry and financial conglomerates demand, receive, and expect to receive for ........ever?...... Personally I have the same thoughts towards the professional athletes with the MFL and MLB In any case what might need to be accomplished to bring these fat cats to their knees, would be to create "mass exodus days", where no one purchases what ever products we are boycotting. Say, for example the population must come to an agreement in order to make it happen correctly, by avoiding certain products for a month of maybe even longer. Let's take the auto industry for example. A group decision is made to General Motors products for three months. Across the nation, what's happening? No one is buying and GM products, and for five or six months, this would be or almost be out on the streets. If the citizens as a whole can come together to give a business the cold shoulder effect I most sincerely suggest we will succeed with "coercing" with them to see things as we feel should be. That being no one receives more then 20 percent then the lowest man in the factory makes sweeping up the slag's. That bonuses are a thing of the past. Ether that or they will go out of business for lack of exchanging their product for cast to the masses. WE hear a lot of don't buy gas on Sundays. You know this is the best means we could control the sale of everything in this world. If the world took the stance that no one would buy a Chevy S-10 for example for a year. Do you realize what that would do to the markets? It would cause crippling effects that would be darn near permanent. How about an entire line of general motors products?......Ringo
quote: Originally posted by fishnfanatic: Your both wrong, mobs should go after politicians, democrat and republicans, as well as corporate fat cats. quote: Originally posted by bounceandburst: quote: Originally posted by Irwin_R_Schyster: No, the outrage is not directed at the real culprits: George W Bush/Dick Cheney.....There should be MOBS harrassing them everywhere they go...
